newsitem.title: UK: Mideast crude tanker market booms, but not rates.
newsitem.headline: Mideast crude tanker market booms, but not rates.

text.p: Booming crude tanker chartering in the key Middle East Gulf was welcomed by owners even if the rise in activity did not herald a rise in rates.
VLCCs and one ULLC found employment both eastwards and westwards. KPC was seen taking a ULCC to the USG, six VLCCs were fixed to the Far East,and Fina fixed 275,000 tonnes into UKC.
VLCC rates Singapore and South Korea remained steady around W65 with VLCC trips to Japan assesssed between W65-73. Tankers bound for the U.S and Europe held firm at W60.
In the inter-UKC sector, rates continued their slight increase from the previous day with 80,000 tonners taking W105.
An 80,000 tonne cargo fixed by Petroleum Limited travelling cross UKC on the Natura was placed at W105, brokers confirmed.
There was a single transatlantic trip seen, in which Sun fixed a 90,000 tonner on the Astro Sirius from Sullom Voe to Puerto Rico.
Rates across the Atlantic were placed around the W66 mark.

Fixing in the Mediterranean was again extremely poor, with a meagre three charters made this week. Brokers were unsure why the market was so quiet. Some said the region was in low gear following some public holidays last week.
The Caribbean market saw rates settle around last done levels, shipping brokers said. Brokers said 70,000 tonners travelling up the US coast were steady around of W130-135.
